page.title: 06Kinbrace School,Kinbrace
page.content: Kinbrace is a small rural school with one composite class catering for five to twelve year olds. It was built in 1883 and was modernised in 1971. We have television and a microcomputer which even the infants can operate. There are only eleven pupils on the roll and we are more like a family than a school. Midday meals come from Helmsdale a village 27 kilometres away. Pupils travel distances of upto 38 kilometres each day. At Christmas we have our party. Santa Claus brings us marvellous presents. In June we have our school sale which is a great success. We sell mouth watering gateaux, begonias, plants, Arran woollens and bags of peat. We have school trips in connection with projects and have visited Culloden Battlefield,Clynelish Distillery, Dornoch Sheriff Court,Dunrobin Castle.
